etymologies: late Middle English. From early modern German centener, centner (German Centner, (now usually) Zentner) weight of a hundred pounds, miniature unit of weight used in assaying metals from classical Latin centēnārium weight of a hundred pounds

definitions: Any of various units of weight equal to approximately one hundred pounds, especially such units used in Germany and the Baltic Sea region. Compare "hundredweight".

notes.text: A centner was measured with a combination of weights, each weighing a number of pounds equal to a power of two, that would total approximately 100 lb. For example, a centner measured using weights of 64 lb, 32 lb, and 16 lb would weigh 112 lb.

definitions: A unit of weight used in assaying metals, typically ranging between three and five grams. Also more fully "assay (or docimastic) centner" and variants.

notes.text: Systems of weight used by assayers employed the same nomenclature as common systems of weight, but on a scale suitable for an assaying sample.
